avalancheActivity.comment:
The avalanche prone locations are to be found at the base of rock walls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain and adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. Gliding avalanches can also occur, in particular on steep grassy slopes.
The wind slabs remain for the foreseeable future prone to triggering, especially adjacent to ridgelines. In all regions medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large avalanches are possible.
Avalanches can be released, mostly by large loads.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The weather will be mild. Backcountry tours should be started and concluded very early.

snowpackStructure.comment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be reduced. The surface of the snowpack will freeze very little and will already be soft in the early morning. On sunny slopes the snowpack is wet all the way through.

tendency.comment: The weather will be mostly sunny. Over a wide area slight warming.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on shady slopes at intermediate and high altitudes. Mostly small avalanches are possible in particular on steep shady slopes. Avalanches can be released, mostly by large loads in isolated cases.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The weather will be partly cloudy.

snowpackStructure.comment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be reduced. The surface of the snowpack will freeze very little and will already be soft in the early morning. On sunny slopes hardly any snow is lying.

tendency.comment: The weather will be mostly sunny. Over a wide area slight warming.
